CommandDoccommentNode.comment:
Combine all the values that can be represented by `Fin n` with an initial value, starting at `0` and nesting to the left.
Example: * `Fin.foldl 3 (· + ·.val) (0 : Nat) = ((0 + (0 : Fin 3).val) + (1 : Fin 3).val) + (2 : Fin 3).val` -/

AtomNode.val:
Combine all the values that can be represented by `Fin n` with an initial value, starting at `0` and nesting to the left.
Example: * `Fin.foldl 3 (· + ·.val) (0 : Nat) = ((0 + (0 : Fin 3).val) + (1 : Fin 3).val) + (2 : Fin 3).val` -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Inner loop for `Fin.foldl`. `Fin.foldl.loop n f x i = f (f (f x i) ...) (n-1)` -/

AtomNode.val: Inner loop for `Fin.foldl`. `Fin.foldl.loop n f x i = f (f (f x i) ...) (n-1)` -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment:
Combine all the values that can be represented by `Fin n` with an initial value, starting at `n - 1` and nesting to the right.
Example: * `Fin.foldr 3 (·.val + ·) (0 : Nat) = (0 : Fin 3).val + ((1 : Fin 3).val + ((2 : Fin 3).val + 0))` -/

AtomNode.val:
Combine all the values that can be represented by `Fin n` with an initial value, starting at `n - 1` and nesting to the right.
Example: * `Fin.foldr 3 (·.val + ·) (0 : Nat) = (0 : Fin 3).val + ((1 : Fin 3).val + ((2 : Fin 3).val + 0))` -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Inner loop for `Fin.foldr`. `Fin.foldr.loop n f i x = f 0 (f ... (f (i-1) x))` -/

AtomNode.val: Inner loop for `Fin.foldr`. `Fin.foldr.loop n f i x = f 0 (f ... (f (i-1) x))` -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment:
Folds a monadic function over all the values in `Fin n` from left to right, starting with `0`.
It is the sequence of steps: ``` Fin.foldlM n f x₀ = do let x₁ ← f x₀ 0 let x₂ ← f x₁ 1 ... let xₙ ← f xₙ₋₁ (n-1) pure xₙ ``` -/

AtomNode.val:
Folds a monadic function over all the values in `Fin n` from left to right, starting with `0`.
It is the sequence of steps: ``` Fin.foldlM n f x₀ = do let x₁ ← f x₀ 0 let x₂ ← f x₁ 1 ... let xₙ ← f xₙ₋₁ (n-1) pure xₙ ``` -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Inner loop for `Fin.foldlM`. ``` Fin.foldlM.loop n f xᵢ i = do let xᵢ₊₁ ← f xᵢ i ... let xₙ ← f xₙ₋₁ (n-1) pure xₙ ``` -/

AtomNode.val: Inner loop for `Fin.foldlM`. ``` Fin.foldlM.loop n f xᵢ i = do let xᵢ₊₁ ← f xᵢ i ... let xₙ ← f xₙ₋₁ (n-1) pure xₙ ``` -/

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type u_1 n : Nat x : α i : Nat h : i < n x✝ : α ⊢ n - (i + 1) < n - i

CommandDoccommentNode.comment:
Folds a monadic function over `Fin n` from right to left, starting with `n-1`.
It is the sequence of steps: ``` Fin.foldrM n f xₙ = do let xₙ₋₁ ← f (n-1) xₙ let xₙ₋₂ ← f (n-2) xₙ₋₁ ... let x₀ ← f 0 x₁ pure x₀ ``` -/

AtomNode.val:
Folds a monadic function over `Fin n` from right to left, starting with `n-1`.
It is the sequence of steps: ``` Fin.foldrM n f xₙ = do let xₙ₋₁ ← f (n-1) xₙ let xₙ₋₂ ← f (n-2) xₙ₋₁ ... let x₀ ← f 0 x₁ pure x₀ ``` -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Inner loop for `Fin.foldrM`. ``` Fin.foldrM.loop n f i xᵢ = do let xᵢ₋₁ ← f (i-1) xᵢ ... let x₁ ← f 1 x₂ let x₀ ← f 0 x₁ pure x₀ ``` -/

AtomNode.val: Inner loop for `Fin.foldrM`. ``` Fin.foldrM.loop n f i xᵢ = do let xᵢ₋₁ ← f (i-1) xᵢ ... let x₁ ← f 1 x₂ let x₀ ← f 0 x₁ pure x₀ ``` -/

OtherNode.state_before: m : Type u_1 → Type u_2 α : Type u_1 n i : Nat inst✝ : Monad m f : α → Fin n → m α x : α h : i < n ⊢ foldlM.loop n f x i = do let x ← f x ⟨i, h⟩ foldlM.loop n f x (i + 1)
m : Type u_1 → Type u_2 α : Type u_1 n : Nat inst✝ : Monad m f : α → Fin n → m α x : α ⊢ foldlM.loop n f x n = pure x

m : Type u_1 → Type u_2 α : Type u_1 n i : Nat inst✝ : Monad m f : α → Fin (n + 1) → m α x : α h : i < n + 1 ⊢ foldlM.loop (n + 1) f x i = do let x ← f x ⟨i, h⟩ foldlM.loop n (fun x j => f x j.succ) x i
OtherNode.tactic: if h' : i < n then rw [foldlM_loop_lt _ _ h] congr; funext rw [foldlM_loop_lt _ _ h', foldlM_loop]; rfl else cases Nat.le_antisymm (Nat.le_of_lt_succ h) (Nat.not_lt.1 h') rw [foldlM_loop_lt] congr; funext rw [foldlM_loop_eq, foldlM_loop_eq]

OtherNode.state_before: case zero α : Sort u_1 f : α → Fin 0 → α x : α ⊢ foldr 0 (fun i x => f x i.rev) x = foldl 0 f x

case succ α : Sort u_1 n : Nat ih : ∀ (f : α → Fin n → α) (x : α), foldr n (fun i x => f x i.rev) x = foldl n f x f : α → Fin (n + 1) → α x : α ⊢ foldr (n + 1) (fun i x => f x i.rev) x = foldl (n + 1) f x
OtherNode.state_after: case succ α : Sort u_1 n : Nat ih : ∀ (f : α → Fin n → α) (x : α), foldr n (fun i x => f x i.rev) x = foldl n f x f : α → Fin (n + 1) → α x : α ⊢ f (foldr n (fun i x => f x i.succ.rev) x) (rev 0) = f (foldr n (fun i x => f x i.rev.castSucc) x) (last n)

OtherNode.state_before: case succ α : Sort u_1 n : Nat ih : ∀ (f : α → Fin n → α) (x : α), foldr n (fun i x => f x i.rev) x = foldl n f x f : α → Fin (n + 1) → α x : α ⊢ f (foldr n (fun i x => f x i.succ.rev) x) (rev 0) = f (foldr n (fun i x => f x i.rev.castSucc) x) (last n)

Comment.text:
Combine all the values that can be represented by `Fin n` with an initial value, starting at `0` and nesting to the left.
Example: * `Fin.foldl 3 (· + ·.val) (0 : Nat) = ((0 + (0 : Fin 3).val) + (1 : Fin 3).val) + (2 : Fin 3).val` -/
Inner loop for `Fin.foldl`. `Fin.foldl.loop n f x i = f (f (f x i) ...) (n-1)` -/

Combine all the values that can be represented by `Fin n` with an initial value, starting at `n - 1` and nesting to the right.
Example: * `Fin.foldr 3 (·.val + ·) (0 : Nat) = (0 : Fin 3).val + ((1 : Fin 3).val + ((2 : Fin 3).val + 0))` -/
Inner loop for `Fin.foldr`. `Fin.foldr.loop n f i x = f 0 (f ... (f (i-1) x))` -/

Folds a monadic function over all the values in `Fin n` from left to right, starting with `0`.
It is the sequence of steps: ``` Fin.foldlM n f x₀ = do let x₁ ← f x₀ 0 let x₂ ← f x₁ 1 ... let xₙ ← f xₙ₋₁ (n-1) pure xₙ ``` -/
Inner loop for `Fin.foldlM`. ``` Fin.foldlM.loop n f xᵢ i = do let xᵢ₊₁ ← f xᵢ i ... let xₙ ← f xₙ₋₁ (n-1) pure xₙ ``` -/

Folds a monadic function over `Fin n` from right to left, starting with `n-1`.
It is the sequence of steps: ``` Fin.foldrM n f xₙ = do let xₙ₋₁ ← f (n-1) xₙ let xₙ₋₂ ← f (n-2) xₙ₋₁ ... let x₀ ← f 0 x₁ pure x₀ ``` -/
Inner loop for `Fin.foldrM`. ``` Fin.foldrM.loop n f i xᵢ = do let xᵢ₋₁ ← f (i-1) xᵢ ... let x₁ ← f 1 x₂ let x₀ ← f 0 x₁ pure x₀ ``` -/
-- the try makes this proof work with and without opaque wf rec
